text:
<@U25PYL3Q8> I finally found this documentation. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/manipulating-forms-with-jquery> 
The first few pages of documentation I found did not show the property options for the hbspt.forms.create() function.

<@U6TBZ66FN> as a continuation of our previous discussion in hubdb, I've also noticed the caching issue in the page manager. I just added some simple JS to the footer and hit "update" and then "update and continue editing" and my changes don't show but if I hit "update page now" the cache is updated and my changes are visible. The issue is a bit frustrating because it adds a few extra steps when I'm updating JS or CSS and sometimes I update the JS & CSS frequently because certain styles display differently on HubSpot compared to my local environment. Is there anything I can provided to help you troubleshoot this issue?
Let me see if I can reproduce.
<@U7G631G5P> Are you using a coded template to add JS to the footer? Can you point me to the page?
I just entered in a console.log in the footer within the page editor. I think this case was actually my mistake though but I do consistently have issues when updating CSS/JS files.
I'll let you know when I come across and issue and can provide you with more information about the page.
Happy to help. We are working on resolve the reverting CSS/JS updating issues. That usually fixes itself in a few minutes.
